alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:35PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harlan, eastern Bell and southern Leslie Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 434 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Beverly to near Hutch. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sandy Fork, Beverly, Saylor, Tacky Town, Stony Fork Junction and Coldiron around 440 PM EDT. Wallins Creek, Spruce Pine, Warbranch and Tremont around 445 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Loyall, Bledsoe, Baxter, Pathfork, Rosspoint, Golden Ash, Kitts, Napier, Hensley Store, Martins Fork, Liggett, Putney, Big Laurel, Arthur, Pine Mountain, Peepace Store, Smith, Martins Fork Lake, Nolansburg, Three Point, Mary Alice and Bobs Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
